parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the cooling fan can cause rapid overheating, coolant loss, and engine damage, potentially leading to accidents, fires, or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: smoke coming out of the hood

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Unintended Braking due to Yaw Rate Sensor Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden and unintended activation of the brakes can cause loss of control, accidents, and potentially serious injuries or fatalities, especially when traveling at high speeds.
symptoms: The vehicle suddenly and unexpectedly brakes
while driving at moderate to high speeds
resulting in a loss of control

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the engine cooling system can cause the engine to overheat, leading to engine damage, and in extreme cases, engine compartment fires, which can result in a total loss of the vehicle and pose a significant risk to the driver and passengers.
symptoms: The temperature gauge rises to the red zone
steam or smoke comes from the hood

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The optical distortion through the windshield can cause driver discomfort, eye strain, and reduced visibility, which can lead to accidents or near-miss incidents.
symptoms: The windshield appears to be warped or curved
causing a distorted view of the road
objects appear to be bent or bowed
the driver experiences eye strain or discomfort
the windshield has a "wavy" or "rippled" appearance.
